alert.note: Alert for Montague (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 13 at 11:52AM CDT until May 15 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Texas and south central Texas, including the following counties, in north central Texas, Bell, Bosque, Comanche, Coryell, Eastland, Erath, Falls, Hamilton, Hood, Jack, Lampasas, McLennan, Mills, Montague, Palo Pinto, Parker, Somervell, Stephens, Wise and Young. In south central Texas, Milam. * WHEN...Through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor-drainage and urban areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall totals of 1 to 2 inches, with isolated higher amounts possible.
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flooding which can be a very dangerous situation. You should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should a warning be issued.
